content.question:
Jordan is working on a business model for a sandwich shop. Based on past data, he developed the model <math alttext="n hat equals, 150 minus 3 p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="n hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>^</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> represents the predicted number of turkey sandwiches sold in one day for a price of <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> dollars per sandwich.
Which of the following is the best description of the slope of the model?

choices.label: For each increase of $3 in the price of the sandwich, the number sold is predicted to decrease, on average, by 150.
For each increase of $3 in the price of the sandwich, the number sold is predicted to increase, on average, by 150.
For each increase of $1 in the price of the sandwich, the number sold is predicted to decrease, on average, by 3.
For each increase of $1 in the price of the sandwich, the number sold is predicted to increase, on average, by 3.
For each increase of $1 in the price of the sandwich, the number sold is predicted to decrease, on average, by 150.

content.answer: For each increase of $1 in the price of the sandwich, the number sold is predicted to decrease, on average, by 3.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
